author: alex
message: Fixed the syntax used for the Python repl examples in docs and docstrings.

files.patch:
@@ -10,8 +10,8 @@
 
     >>> from django.core.files import locks
     >>> with open('./file', 'wb') as f:
-    >>>     locks.lock(f, locks.LOCK_EX)
-    >>>     f.write('Django')
+    ...     locks.lock(f, locks.LOCK_EX)
+    ...     f.write('Django')
 """
 
 __all__ = ('LOCK_EX','LOCK_SH','LOCK_NB','lock','unlock')

@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@
 ...     description="Testing."
 ... )
 >>> with open('test.rss', 'w') as fp:
->>>     feed.write(fp, 'utf-8')
+...     feed.write(fp, 'utf-8')
 
 For definitions of the different versions of RSS, see:
 http://diveintomark.org/archives/2004/02/04/incompatible-rss

@@ -240,7 +240,7 @@ Sample usage::
     ...     description="Testing."
     ... )
     >>> with open('test.rss', 'w') as fp:
-    >>>     feed.write(fp, 'utf-8')
+    ...     feed.write(fp, 'utf-8')
 
 For simplifying the selection of a generator use ``feedgenerator.DefaultFeed``
 which is currently ``Rss201rev2Feed``

@@ -771,7 +771,7 @@ arguments at time of construction:
 
             >>> c = Client()
             >>> with open('wishlist.doc') as fp:
-            >>>     c.post('/customers/wishes/', {'name': 'fred', 'attachment': fp})
+            ...     c.post('/customers/wishes/', {'name': 'fred', 'attachment': fp})
 
         (The name ``attachment`` here is not relevant; use whatever name your
         file-processing code expects.)
